intro: Rhynchospora glomerata f. controversa, commonly known as the clustered spike sedge, is a botanical variant of the clustered spike sedge, characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense stands in suitable environments. The subspecies is notable for its morphological variability, which has led to taxonomic debate among botanists.
